page.title: 17ROWNEY WARREN
page.content: Near to Shefford is a wood called {Rowney Warren}where people go to take their dogs for walks and to have picnics.There is a nature trail which was made by the children at Robert Bloomfield SChool.The Warren used to be called Shefford Common and it used to belong to the people of Shefford. We found a letter from Dorothy Osborne who lived at Chicksands Priory in the 17th century. She says she used to walk over the common to talk to the shepherdesses from Shefford. In the Middle Ages people dug there for iron stone and melted it to get the iron out.We saw the holes they left. In the 3rd century there was a kiln in the Warren for making pottery to sell to local farmers.We have some of the broken pots in our school.
